transportAdvice: Los Angeles is a sprawling city where a car is the most practical way to get around, though a metro rail and bus network does connect key areas including downtown, Hollywood, and some beach communities. Taxis and ride-hail vehicles are widely available, but walking between major attractions is generally not practical given the distances involved.

weather.description: Mild and occasionally rainy, January is one of the wetter months but still pleasant compared to most of the country.
Similar to January with mild temperatures and a reasonable chance of rain showers.
Spring begins with warming days and gradually decreasing rainfall.
Warm and mostly dry with comfortable temperatures ideal for outdoor sightseeing.
May brings the characteristic morning coastal fog known locally as June Gloom beginning to appear, with mild afternoons.
Early summer is often overcast in the mornings along the coast but clears to warm afternoons inland.
Hot and sunny with very little rain, July is peak beach season with long bright days.
The hottest month of the year with dry, sunny conditions and warm evenings.
Still warm and dry, September is one of the best months to visit with clear skies and comfortable heat.
Temperatures begin to ease and Santa Ana winds can bring hot, dry spells inland.
Cooler and occasionally rainy as the wet season returns, though still mild by most standards.
Cool and sometimes rainy with festive atmosphere in the city, though outdoor activities remain possible on clear days.
